definition: to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)

sentences.english: They not only pollute the air in cities， but make them crowded.
sentences.chinese: 汽車不僅污染城市空氣，而且使城市擁擠不堪。

sentences.english: They not only pollute the air in cities, but make them crowed.
sentences.chinese: 汽車不僅污染城市空氣，而且使城市擁擠不堪。

sentences.english: Thousands of refugees are packed into over-crowded towns and villages.
sentences.chinese: 成千上萬的難民湧入擁擠不堪的城鎮和村莊。

sentences.english: This sitting room will be bursting at the seams when all the guests arrive.
sentences.chinese: 當所有客人到來時，這間會客室將會擁擠不堪。

sentences.english: Passengers cram onto one of the buses to Shangdi and Zhongguancun.
sentences.chinese: 擁擠不堪的到“上地科技園”的公交。

sentences.english: Crowded shops are a happy hunting-ground for pick-pockets.
sentences.chinese: 擁擠不堪的商店是扒手行竊最得手的地方。

sentences.english: Stallholders stand behind tiny tightly cluttered stalls.
sentences.chinese: 攤販站在小小的擁擠不堪的攤子後面。

sentences.english: City will bulkiness and crowd extremely.
sentences.chinese: 城市將會龐大擁擠不堪。

sentences.english: The path of whiners is full.
sentences.chinese: 那條滿是牢騷者的道路上也擁擠不堪。

sentences.english: At five o'clock in the afternoon the city streets are a series of bottlenecks.
sentences.chinese: 下午五點市中心的街道就成了擁擠不堪的窄路。

sentences.english: That helps make India's congested roads the deadliest in the world.
sentences.chinese: 也正因此，印度擁擠不堪的街道是世界上最致命的。
